_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Continental Carbonic Products, Inc.
                                              Executive Summary
Continental Carbonic is committed to the health, safety and environmental protection of its employees and the environment. Our Risk Management Plan is as follows:

1.      Continental Carbonic is a liquid and dry ice manufacturer and distributer. The facility will have approximately 75 employees, which includes 25 truck drivers and 2-3 clerical staff. The company has been in business since 1976 and has its corporate headquarters in Decatur, Illinois. Upon being hired by Continental Carbonic employees receive an orientation regarding chemicals kept at the location and where the chemicals are stored. Employees are taught how to respond in an emergency and how to exit the building through any door way to an evacuation point. 

2.    Continental Carbonic will work with local emergency response agencies for emergency responses to the Greenville, Ohio Plant. Employees will evacuate the building immediately upon having a release of anhydrous ammonia. Upon exiting the building, employees will observe the wind direction sock and stay upwind and go to a main gathering point to be accounted for. All piping will be labeled with labeling diagram given to local emergency responders. Immediately upon knowing of a release local fire, police, ambulance and LEPC will be notified. Employees will receive initial training as they are orientated to work at the plant. All controls and valves are marked and painted, which a diagram will be given to local emergency responders. 

Continental Carbonic's maintenance department has a preventive maintenance program for checking and maintaining ammonia valves and piping. Weekly, monthly and annual inspections will be made of equipment to assure integrity of ammonia systems. 

3.    Anhydrous Ammonia receiver is located on the South East corner outside of the building. Ammonia is piped into a closed loop system and will

have approximately 18,082 pounds. Since ammonia can be smelled at less than 25 ppm employees will be notified to evacuate the facility anytime they have a heavy smell of ammonia. Upon exiting the building they will go to gathering point upwind to be accounted for. At the same time the supervisor/manager will call emergency responders to help evaluate the leak and possible cause of leak. 

4.    The worse-case scenario and the alternative release scenario(s), including administrative controls and mitigation measures to limit the distances for each reported scenario is:

a.    Worst case scenario (e.g., failure of the storage tank containing 18,082 pounds of ammonia liquid spills and vaporizes with duration of release being ten minutes. 
b.    Distance to endpoint is 1.7 miles (under worse-case weather, the substance could impact 2267 residents. Continental will work with local emergency responders for best way to notify residents and advising residents of what to do in case of ammonia release. 

5.    Continental Carbonic is in compliance with OSHA PSM and RMP rule and accidental reporting requirements. Upon having a release of reportable quantity immediate notifications will be made to local, state and federal governmental agencies. The facility will be equipped with both visual and audible alarms, which will notify employees of a leak or release.  

6.    Since this is a new facility there have been no releases or accidents within the past five years. 

7.    Safety and community involvement is important to Continental Carbonic, therefore personnel at the Greenville Plant will collaborate with local emergency personnel on a regular basis. The emergency response program for this facility has been written and is being conveyed to local emergency response personnel. The corporate director of loss control has made contact with each of the local agencies and will schedule a tour of the facility to give specific instructions on chemical storage and locations of chemicals. The plan will s

eek suggestions and minimal annual visits from local emergency responders. 

8.    Upon making changes to the plant safety or chemical storage program Continental Carbonic will make notification to all local and state agencies as the plan calls for.
